nodes.bodyText: Why can't we just use the CallParameter with all of these annotations? Why do we need a separate JsonCallParameter class?

This was what I wanted to do at the beginning but the CallParameter class is in the core module and allows to use the TransactionSimulator. I looked in the core module and outside of the tests no class has this kind of annotation JsonProperty
As CallParamater is used in code to call the TransactionSimulator and JsonCallParamater is used to call RPC APIs. You may want to pass additional fields to the API without needing to pass it to the simulator. So for me it is two distinct objects but we can inherit for the common part

I can only easily imagine the simulator taking more parameters than a call parameter in the rpc since the simulator would need to know at least as much info as a normal call to do its job. Even if that happens eventually, that person will be empowered to split it in whichever way works for them.
I don't think that other classes in the package not using JsonProperty annotations need block us from adding it. If it keeps the data model cleaner that's a plus. Also, if "it hasn't been done before" becomes a justification for things then many people can come across the same problem with the same solution and discard it because "it hasn't been done before", thus preventing others from seeing it has been done before.

I don't think that other classes in the package not using JsonProperty annotations need block us from adding it.

I just merged the two classes. I don't have a strong opinion on that.

Even if that happens eventually, that person will be empowered to split it in whichever way works for them.

👍
